function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Testing mobile application in a smaller clinic may result in potential exposure to contagious diseases for the operators and patients.","Impact":"Potential spread of contagious diseases among operators and patients, leading to increased health risks and potential outbreak.","Mitigation":"Implement strict hygiene protocols, use protective gear, and conduct regular testing for operators and patients. Limit the number of people involved in testing.","Technologies":"Contact tracing apps, remote monitoring devices, and digital health platforms for tracking and monitoring potential exposure. Use of virtual reality for training rather than physical interaction.","People":"Operators, patients, and anyone in proximity to the clinic during testing.","Owner":"Clinic management, healthcare authorities, and mobile application developers."},{"Description":"Expansion of the digital twin framework to a bigger case may involve the introduction of new smartphones and badges, leading to potential risks of contamination and disease spread.","Impact":"Increased risk of contamination and spread of diseases as new devices are introduced to a larger clinic setting.","Mitigation":"Thorough sanitization of new devices, strict guidelines for device handling, limiting physical interaction during deployment, and regular health screening for operators involved in the expansion.","Technologies":"UV disinfection devices for smartphones and badges, touchless technology for device deployment, and remote device management software to limit physical handling.","People":"Operators, patients, and staff in the larger clinic during expansion.","Owner":"Clinic management, IT department, and healthcare authorities."},{"Description":"Implementing a digital twin for each specific clinic due to non-linear relationships between clinic size and configuration may result in increased resource and time investment for implementation.","Impact":"Higher resource and time investment for creating individual digital twins for different clinics, leading to potential delays and increased costs.","Mitigation":"Develop modular digital twin frameworks that can be customized for different clinic sizes, invest in automation for digital twin creation, and use data-driven algorithms to optimize configuration based on clinic size and properties.","Technologies":"Modular digital twin platforms, machine learning algorithms for configuration optimization, and automation tools for digital twin creation.","People":"Digital twin developers, healthcare consultants, and clinic management.","Owner":"Healthcare authorities, clinic management, and digital twin development team."}]}
